content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 143.3 - Authority of the director of classification and compensation to authorize shift pay differentials on an area basis and of varying amounts

State Regulations

When the Director of Classification and Compensation finds
that in a particular geographic area or areas wage practices prevailing among
private and other non-State employers for a given occupation would warrant a
shift pay differential for employees in the same or related occupations in the

State service without, however, any substantiating evidence that such wage
practices are prevailing on a Statewide basis, he may, after a hearing which
shall afford the employees affected or their representatives an opportunity to
appear and be heard, authorize a shift pay differential, subject to the
approval of the Director of the Budget, for such same or related occupations in

State service in one or more geographic areas which may vary among geographic
areas and among work shifts. Notes
